title: Part d. [0–7]
stimulusHtml:
7 points (i. 3 points; ii. 2 points; iii. 2 points)

i. 3 points

Maximum speed occurs when the net force is zero

∑ F = 0

1 point: For a correct equation relating gravitational and spring forces
mg = kx
x= mg k MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaamyBaiaadEgaaeaacaWGRbaaaaaa@3AD7@
1 point: For the correct numeric substitution of the mass obtained in part c. and k obtained in part a.
x= ( 0.69kg )( 9.8m/ s 2 ) 25kg/ s 2 x=0.27m MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWG4b Gaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaadaqadaqaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGOnaiaaiMda caWGRbGaam4zaaGaayjkaiaawMcaamaabmaabaGaaGyoaiaac6caca aI4aGaamyBaiaac+cacaWGZbWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaaGccaGL OaGaayzkaaaabaGaaGOmaiaaiwdacaWGRbGaam4zaiaac+cacaWGZb WaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaaaaaOqaaiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIWaGa aiOlaiaaikdacaaI3aGaamyBaaaaaa@5187@
1 point: For adding the unstretched cord length to the value of x calculated above
Yvmax = 0.27 m + 0.60 m
Yvmax = 0.87 m

Notes:

  • The second and third points were awarded only if the first point was awarded.

  • Full credit was awarded for a correct solution that takes the minimum of a potential function or the maximum of a kinetic energy function to determine Yvmax .

ii. 2 points

Note: These points could be awarded only if the first point in d.i. was awarded.

1 point: For a correct statement that acceleration is zero or switches from downwards to upwards at that point

Note: This point was also awarded for stating that the potential energy is a minimum at that point, which implies that the kinetic energy and speed are at their maximum values.

1 point: For an additional correct statement and no incorrect statements regarding the motion

Example: The acceleration is zero when the two forces are equal in magnitude. Since the acceleration switches from downward to upward (aligned with the velocity to opposing the velocity), the velocity changes from increasing to decreasing.

iii. 2 points

1 point: For a correct energy expression
